Rexed lamina V.SuperCategory: Rexed spinal cord parcellation scheme region
Rexed lamina V.Definition: Lamina forming the neck of the dorsal horn, lying deep to lamina IV, characterized by neurons more heterogeneous in shape and size than those in lamina IV, althought he border between IV and V is difficult to distinguish, particularly medially (Paxinos, The rat nervous system, 2nd ed, page 43).  From Rexed:  "[Lamina V] goes straight between the medial and the lateral side of the dorsal horn. It has fewer cells than layers I to IV and more and thicker nerve fibers are running through it. In the lateral part of the 5th layer the fiber bundles are large and numerous and often give the section a reticulated appearance. Here also some fairly large nerve cells are found. The lateral part of layer V corresponds to the formatio reticularis.
